meanings.sent1: The teacher kept chivying the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: She was chivying her brother to clean his room before their parents came home.
meanings.sent3: The little bird chivied the cat playfully, trying to get its attention.
meanings.sent4: The persistent raindrops chivied the leaves on the tree, making them dance.
meanings.sent5: The wind chivied the clouds across the sky, creating a beautiful sunset.

meanings.definition: To urge or prod someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The coach kept chivying the players to give their best performance in the game.
meanings.sent2: He chivied his friend to join him on the adventure to the top of the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The dog chivied its owner to take it for a walk by bringing the leash.
meanings.sent4: The music chivied her feet to dance along to the rhythm of the beat.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies chivied her to the kitchen, eager for a taste.

meanings.definition: The act of pestering or annoying someone to do something
meanings.sent1: Her constant chivying about cleaning the garage was starting to annoy her family.
meanings.sent2: The persistent chivying from her siblings made her decide to finish her chores quickly.
meanings.sent3: The little boy's chivying for more candy finally made his mom laugh at his persistence.
meanings.sent4: The chivying of the mosquitoes around the campfire made everyone reach for the bug spray.
meanings.sent5: The chivying of the alarm clock in the morning was always a rude awakening.
